intro: Spyridium stenophyllum subsp. stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, aromatic leaves. The species produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. The plant is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments.
